name: ServiceNow
description: ServiceNow automates and streamlines work and helps create great employee and customer experiences.

dataTypes.name: Hostname
dataTypes.description: Matches on possible Hostnames lookups which can be a single search term between 5 and 25 characters using A-Z, 0-9 and dashes.

dataTypes.name: Incident ID
dataTypes.description: Matches on possible Incident IDs of the format INC0000000 where zeroes can be any integer value from 0 to 9.

dataTypes.name: Knowledge Base ID
dataTypes.description: Matches on possible Knowledge Base IDs of the format KB0000000 where zeroes can be any integer value from 0 to 9.

dataTypes.name: Change ID
dataTypes.description: Matches on possible Change IDs of the format CHG0000000 where zeroes can be any integer value from 0 to 9.

dataTypes.name: Request ID
dataTypes.description: Matches on possible Request IDs of the format REQ0000000 where zeroes can be any integer value from 0 to 9.

dataTypes.name: Request Item ID
dataTypes.description: Matches on possible Request Item IDs of the format RITM0000000 where zeroes can be any integer value from 0 to 9.

dataTypes.name: SC Task ID
dataTypes.description: Matches on possible Catalog Task IDs of the format SCTASK0000000 where zeroes can be any integer value from 0 to 9.

dataTypes.name: Task ID
dataTypes.description: Matches on possible Task IDs of the format TASK0000000 where zeroes can be any integer value from 0 to 9.

options.name: URL
options.description: The URL of the ServiceNow instance to connect to including the schema (i.e., https://)

options.name: Username (Required)
options.description: The username to login to ServiceNow. If using OAuth (i.e., Client ID and Secret are provided), the Username and Password should be for the OAuth Application User.

options.name: Password (Required)
options.description: The password for the provided Username used to login to ServiceNow.  If using OAuth (i.e., Client Id and Secret are provided), the Username and Password should be for the OAuth Application User.

options.name: OAuth Client ID (Optional)
options.description: Optional Client ID which is required when authenticating to ServiceNow via OAuth.  If provided, a corresponding Client Secret must also be provided. Can be left blank when authenticating via Basic Auth.

options.name: OAuth Client Secret (Optional)
options.description: Optional Client Secret which is required when authenticating to ServiceNow via OAuth.  If provided, a corresponding Client ID must also be provided. Can be left blank when authenticating via Basic Auth.

options.name: Search By Annotated Entities
options.description: This will toggle whether to search ServiceNow for annotated entities found in your channels.  The "string" Data Type must also be enabled for this option to have an effect.

options.name: Enable Incident Search
options.description: If checked, the integration will search ServiceNow's Incident Table (incident) for IP Addresses, Domains, CVEs, annotated entities, and any added custom types

options.name: Incident Query Fields
options.description: A comma separated list of fields to search when querying for Incidents.  Incident searches are done for IPs, domains, CVEs, annotated entities and any added custom types. IMPORTANT -- ServiceNow does not return an error if invalid fields are provided and will instead return all records.

options.name: Incident Search Window in Days
options.description: Number of days back to search when searching incidents.  Filters based on the date that the Incident was opened. Defaults to 360.

options.name: Enable Asset Search
options.description: If checked, the integration will search ServiceNow's Asset Table (alm_asset) for IP Addresses, Domains, CVEs, annotated entities, and any added custom types.

options.name: Asset Query Fields
options.description: A comma separated list of fields to search when querying for Assets. Asset searches are done for IPs, domains, CVEs, annotated entities and any added custom types. NOTE: If a field is not in this list, the field will not be searched in ServiceNow's Asset (alm_asset) Table.
